title: A. Persistent deficits in social communication and social interaction across multiple contexts, as manifested by all of the following:

subcriteria.title: A2. Deficits in nonverbal communicative behaviors used for social interaction
A3. Deficits in developing, maintaining, and understanding relationships

title: B. Restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior, interests, or activities, as manifested by at least two of the following:

subcriteria.title: B1. Stereotyped or repetitive motor movements, use of objects, or speech
B2. Insistence on sameness, inflexible adherence to routines, or ritualized patterns of verbal or nonverbal behavior
B3. Highly restricted, fixated interests that are abnormal in intensity or focus
B4. Hyper- or hyporeactivity to sensory input or unusual interest in sensory aspects of the environment

title: C. Symptoms must be present in the early developmental period (but may not become fully manifest until social demands exceed limited capacities, or may be masked by learned strategies in later life).
D. Symptoms cause clinically significant impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas of current functioning.
E. These disturbances are not better explained by intellectual disability (intellectual developmental disorder) or global developmental delay.
